TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Ah I'm now seeing where the strut issue on my craft files is coming from. The struts that I thought were stock are actually KW. I'm too lazy right now to replace those struts, so that's tomorrow. Until then, I ask that you have KW (or at least the strut parts in that pack, if you're smart enough to do that) installed to use my craft files.

BTW Beale, any progress on the Fuji re-dev?

Ah, okay, we know the problem some were having now

The FUJI: I am sadly caught up with work again. Perhaps the OM today.

Perhaps...

HA! I love that song! What are the odds you'd select it?! Well probably pretty good actually, considering you're from Italy. Still though, quite a coincidence.

Ha! Thankyou.

It is a "classic" (At least to me). I am happy it has found an audience in the greater world!

A little tricky to use, as, as I found out many renditions were sing by outspoken supporters of Fascism, er...

Thankfully not the version I choose, which is from the film of the same name.

Eeeeeeee!

Beale, you talk all the time about "Oh, if only I had more time..." but it seems to me you get a phenomenal amount done! Love your work, as always.

Thanks!

I have to make time

http://i.imgur.com/chn3zEF.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/E9kFdWH.jpg

The Shenzhou module is fantastic.

Also, did the launchers get a rebalance/realism pass?

If so, the Soyuz launcher seems to be more reasonably powered (although I still have to throttle down the engines a lot, using FAR).

The larger launcher, however, can still function as a VTOL SSTO...

Wow! Nice stuff. Glad to see it finding uses.

The Soyuz launcher, yes it has had a bit of re-tuning.

The Proton, untouched. I realise it can put small payloads up in one stage.

I must give it a look...

This had been brought up a few versions ago but the antennas unlike their stock counterparts still have physics enabled.

Oops! Fixed!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=ly3QCqLvLKA

Thank you for the music there! (Maybe not quite my taste, but some will enjoy!)

For the Fuji:

Now I reasonably close to finishing it. A release soon.

The drawback will be lack of IVA. For a few parts now this is the case.

I am sorry for this really, they are very time-intensive it seems. I think after Fuji focus for Tantares will be on getting the "lost" IVAs into the game.

Energia

Expect some Energia / Zenit related news fairly soon, also

Um, just now trying out the "Proton" ALV which decoupler is supposed to be used? (Love the engine fairings BTW)

Um, just now trying out the "Proton" ALV which decoupler is supposed to be used? (Love the engine fairings BTW)

You should use the blue stock 2.5m stack decoupler.

Edited December 8, 2014 by AppleDavidJeans
clarification

You should use the stock 2.5m stack decoupler.

Or use some low-profile decoupler found in many mods (my favorite is one from NovaPunch). Stock 2.5m decoupler is ugly, IMO - it totally breaks nice, sleek designs with its fattiness and yellowness.

Or use some low-profile decoupler found in many mods (my favorite is one from NovaPunch). Stock 2.5m decoupler is ugly, IMO - it totally breaks nice, sleek designs with its fattiness and yellowness.

I use the little blue separator for the "Nice Sleek Rocket"
Which get shot back into the discarded stage and explodes which is why I ask. The yellow/black/ugly one performs better, but it's ugly.

Which get shot back into the discarded stage and explodes which is why I ask. The yellow/black/ugly one performs better, but it's ugly.

I typically use the blue 2.5m separator, yes.

But, I have yet to experience this!

Ehm... Yes, soon there will be 2.5m decoupler I imagine.

The stock 2.5m separator is also rather weak due to it's short height. Basically incompatible with physical time-warp.

Edited December 8, 2014 by Beale

So, using the Altair capsule's integrated decoupler, I flipped it over to build a cool-looking 2-stage Mun lander:

The only problem with it being that the crew crawl out of the hatch head-first:

And fall down:

And in an incredible show of strength - flip over the lander when they stand up under the ladder! xD

You had one job, Halfrod, just one job...

(i use MechJeb)

I have discovered that if I wait longer then 1 sec to fire the engines of the next stage, the seperator does not kerplode.

As a side note, doesn't the next stage engine ignite BEFORE separation on the Russian rockets with that open bracing between the stages? I thought that was why they are open like that, but I could be wrong.

Edited December 9, 2014 by tg626

Boosters, use the shift key with the "a,d -s,w - q,e" keys and angle the extendable ladder out more so that it doesn't stick into the ground. That why the kerbals can move away from an otherwise perfectly good lander.

I hope that there will be Energ-etic and something that we haven't zenit before.

I need to make up new puns.....

Oh and I've been working on a future version of Strings (that atmospheric probe thing a few pages back). I just need time to launch it.

Edited December 9, 2014 by gooddog15

As a side note, doesn't the next stage engine ignite BEFORE separation on the Russian rockets with that open bracing between the stages? I thought that was why they are open like that, but I could be wrong.

That's right, cause they use the thrust of the previous stage as ullage to help ignite the next stage. I really hope we'll get decoupler fairings that are like that in Tantares someday<3
Wait... Couldn't we just scale the included gray decoupler up to 2.5m? That would just take a config.

Soon we will have the "Mesh" fairings, do not worry

Wait... Couldn't we just scale the included gray decoupler up to 2.5m? That would just take a config.

Yeah, for sure!

Copy TLV_Decoupler_A folder, and...

Change:

name = TLV_Decoupler_tg626
module = Part
author = Tantares

mesh = model.mu
scale = 1
rescaleFactor = 2.5

And now, you have a larger decoupler

Also, might want to up the ejection force.

MODULE
{
	name = ModuleDecouple
	explosiveNodeID = top
	ejectionForce = 500
}

Why I do not do this: I like every part to look different as an icon, so you know immediately what you are grabbing in the VAB.

Edited December 9, 2014 by Beale
